inputs.document_type: TM E 30-420 Italian Military Forces (1943) - US Army Intelligence Manual
data_requirements: Aircraft types and quantities per unit
Base locations in Libya (Tripoli, Benghazi, Derna, Tobruk)
Regia Aeronautica command structure in North Africa

prompt_context:
You are a military historian extracting Italian Regia Aeronautica aircraft data from TM E 30-420, a US Army intelligence manual on Italian forces.

Task: Extract ALL factual information about Italian Regia Aeronautica air force units operating in North Africa/Libya during Q2 1941 (April-June 1941).

Focus on:
- Regia Aeronautica North Africa command
- Fighter units (Caccia) - MC.200, MC.202, CR.42
- Bomber units (Bombardamento) - SM.79, Cant Z.1007, BR.20
- Reconnaissance units (Ricognizione)
- Organization: Stormo (wing) → Gruppo (group) → Squadriglia (squadron)
- Section 149 has specific aircraft type information

Key Italian aircraft in 1941-Q2:
- MC.200 Saetta (primary fighter, already operational)
- MC.202 Folgore (new fighter, entering service mid-1941)
- SM.79 Sparviero (primary torpedo bomber/medium bomber)
- CR.42 Falco (biplane fighter, still in use)
- Cant Z.1007 Alcione (medium bomber)

For each fact extracted, provide:
1. The fact itself (in English)
2. Source citation (section number, page)
3. Confidence level (0-100)
4. Category (organization|aircraft|personnel|equipment|command)
5. Original Italian terminology if relevant

Output format: JSON array of facts with structure:
[
  {
    "fact": "string",
    "source_citation": "TM E 30-420, Section X",
    "confidence": 95,
    "category": "aircraft",
    "italian_term": "original Italian term",
    "notes": "any additional context"
  }
]

Important: This is a Tier 1 primary source (95% confidence baseline). Preserve original Italian unit designations (Stormo, Gruppo, Squadriglia).
